pros: Telling me their is no other health insurance

review_title: Fast Paced and Great for Anyone Looking for a Challenge
pros: fast-paced, gain medical experience, multidisciplinary team, clinical experience
cons: Lack of support for social workers, demanding work, little training/ orientation

job_title: Senior Surgical Technologist in Boston, MA
pros: They pay very well as long as you have experience and on sight parking is 7.25$ a week and they have a Dunkin Donuts on sight
cons: In the OR they run out of things since they don't have the infrastructure to support the influx of new surgeons and their patient population. Most of the present staff are having trouble with the new changes and some are trying to hold on to what they think they control. They want to be a big institution but they think are run the place like a sub par hospital

pros:
Dedicated staff committed to providing care and treatment to individuals in care, often under difficult conditions.
Generous Benefits
Stability
Flexibility
Time Off
cons:
Slow salary growth- 
Salary caps off
Union representation 
Low level of control
Lazy coworkers - Unfortunately, poor performers are rarely coached to better performance or fired for cause.

Number of serious issues, including poor living conditions and high degrees of violence in some units, both between individuals in care and directed towards staff.  The poor material conditions in the units,, the  lack of sufficient, experienced staff and complaints about the appearance quality of the food contribute to a climate where an individual in care's behavior is difficult to monitor and to manage by staff. Also, the mix of patients (long-term patients with new arrivals or older patients with more acute medical conditions with younger, less medically fragile individuals as well as the integration of individuals in care with forensic and civil status) on certain units appears to contribute to a volatile atmosphere. We operate in a culture of acceptance that many of the more serious incidents are caused by a few so-called ‘difficult individuals in care" Possibility of violence occurring in the workplace.

review_title: A very ruff experience working with pretrial forensic individuals with mental illness
pros: The pay was good but the violence was just to much.
cons: To much violence. It was like working in a prison.

review_title: Not A Good Place To Work
pros: Very well know hospital with a lot of history.
cons: Very negative atmosphere that is detrimental to both staff and patients. The institution's history of problems still plays out today. Some staff are not very friendly. A lot of violence. It can be scary.
